column1: Kata Robata////The food was all very nice.  The fish was very fresh and expertly cut.  The execution of each dish was elegant and refined.  However
column2: the flavors were generally muted and unmemorable.  Highlights included a raw octopus crudo special
column4: though simple.  We had two rolls - the Tropical Spicy Tuna Roll
column5: and the Texas Hamachi.  Both were fine
column6: but I actually had trouble distinguishing them from each other
column7: despite completely different ingredients.  Nothing really stood out.  We avoided the Uni and King Crab Spoons due to the many poor reviews on this site
column8: which was sad because we LOVE them at Kubo.
